subject: Test Fixture Setup
msgSnippet: In NUnit/.NET land we had test FixtureSetup/FixtureTearDown (run once for each test fixture, not once a test case) in addition to regular setUp and tearDown.
messageBody:
In NUnit/.NET land we had test FixtureSetup/FixtureTearDown (run once for
each test fixture, not once a test case) in addition to regular setUp and
tearDown. I've tended to use these methods when I want to do something
expensive (File I/O etc.). While I know I should avoid expensive operations
in my test cases sometimes they are very useful. So is there are a standard
idiom for doing fixture setup? Do I resort to statics?

BTW I know and like Cedric's TestNG ï¿½ however our organisation is sold on
JUnit for now and I'm making enough waves on the process front.
Finally, yes I have googled the obvious variations on this question.

Thanks
Mark Levison


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
